column2: What are core competencies for Data Stewards?

column1: ability to scope, ontologies, ability to talk to researchers and techs in their language
best practices for data management and sharing
Facility with technical aspects of data management
Cultural change - getting researchers to embed practices
knowledge and use of Persistent Identifiers
Understanding of related research domain, understanding of data architecture, nomenclature, metadata, ontology, data lifecycle
Build enterprise wide data models/harmonize, Understand network of target repositories for specialized data sets (eg GEO or SRA submissions), Manage data mgt plan requirements
Data interoperability adequate for integrating for analyses
Understanding of FAIR data point implenetation and how repositories can be made fair
data champion, data policy, data lifecycle, reports to someone who can make policies/changes within the company/division/group
A sherpa for researchers on "what to do with my data to make it comply with community practices, institution requirements, funder policy, and publisher policy"
dissemination of data in different contexts - research, government, etc.
Programming with natural language processing and other metadata curation tools
knowledge of machine actionable data management plans
Include basic data management skills as part of grad school curriculum
support research projects during the life cycle with preservation
Creating and implementing data stewardship plans
Understand the need for a collection policy
being able to provide training/education in computational skills (a la The Carpentries)
multiple but they don't know they are data stewards
None but we hope to build a process and start hiring some by 2022

column2: How many Data Stewards does your workplace employ?
What kind of Data Stewardship training is needed?
I would like a FAIR Data Stewardship community to...

column1: Guide me to Data Stewardship tools
